metadata.title: CVE-2020-14152 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In IJG JPEG (aka libjpeg) before 9d, jpeg_mem_available() in jmemnobs.c indjpeg does not honor the max_memory_to_use setting, possibly causingexcessive memory consumption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.4
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.4
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.4
libturbojpeg - 1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libjpeg6b: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
libjpeg-turbo package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.2-0ubuntu5.18.04.4').
libjpeg9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
